loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Felipe de oficio agricultor, originario de Santa Teresa comunidad de Condega, Estelí. Expresa sus agradecimiento por apoyo brindado atravez del crédito , el cual le ayuda a darle un buen mantenimiento a sus siembra , sin la ayuda económica no habría podido sacar su producción. El siguiente periodo de siembra está por comenzar y necesita comprar insumos de siembras y pagar mano de obra es por esto que solicita este financiamiento, espera sembrar 3 manzanas de frijol rojo. Siempre tiene la meta de mejorar también el ganado para vender leche.
texts.en: Felipe is a farmer.  He’s originally from Santa Teresa, a community in Condega, Estelí.  He has expressed his gratitude for the support he’s gotten through this loan, which will help him to care for his crops.  He would not have been able to harvest his crop without financial assistance.  The next planting season is about to begin and he needs to buy supplies and pay for labor, so he is asking for this loan.  He expects to be able to plant three plots of red beans.  He always has a goal to also improve his livestock so that he can also sell milk.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Biath Al-Thlg Group

texts.en:
This group is called Biath Al-Thlg and consists of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Linda is a 31-year-old married woman with three children. She intends to buy a fridge for her house but she doesn`t have money. So, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her house.

loans.name: Al-Wafa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wafa and consists of four ladies. They work hard to a offer good life for their family. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER.

Fatima is a 30-year-old married woman who doesn't have children. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She has a house and she wants to renew her house, so she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials to renew her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renew her house.

loans.name: Amran Group

texts.en:
This group is called Amran and consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Yusra is 23 years old. She has two children. She has a house and she is a housewife. She is a hardworking and enthusiastic person who very much wants to succeed. She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy home appliances for her home. She hopes to enroll her children in private school and to buy a bus.

loans.use: to buy appliances for her home.

loans.name: Luzarina

texts.en: Luzarina is 62 years old from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has been engaged in the fishing business for 20 years now. She also sells fresh fish and makes dried fish for additional income. She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish, seashells, and fish to process into dried fish. Her income will be helpful so she can provide a healthy diet for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business for a better income.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish, seashells, and fish to process into dried fish

loans.name: Nolasco

texts.en: Nolasco is 43 years old. He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has had a beauty parlor which has been his source of income for quite some time now. He is asking for a loan to buy hair treatment essentials, beauty products, and hair care products. He works hard and hopes to provide a better service to his customers so he can continue to attract more. Nolasco hopes to be more successful in the future and to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy hair treatment essentials, beauty products, and hair care products

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a 59-year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with six children ages 19-38.  She has operated a sari-sari store for income for 12 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as rice and canned goods. Lilia knows that this will help for her to not run out of stock of these items, which she sells on a daily basis. In the future, she hopes to retire from working hard and enjoy her golden years in comfort.

loans.use: to buy rice and canned goods

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en: Like most people in San Miguel, 23 year old Angelo is in the rice-farming business. He is married and has a baby who is one year old. He wants to provide for his child better, so he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. He aimed to increase the profitability of his business, so he works hard in his farm.  His income will go to his family’s daily consumption; for his baby's milk and diaper needs. In the future, he hopes to have a bigger farm for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 2, 3, 8, and 9. 

Maricel is raising hogs for an income so she can help the needs of her family. This business started three years ago. She plans to use her loan to buy feed and rice for her family's consumption. The feed will help fatten her hogs so she can easily market her animals in four months' time. Maricel hopes that she will be able to produce healthy hogs that will attract buyers from the market at a good price. 

She plans to improve and increase the hogs that she is raising in the future so her business will be more stable.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice for her family's consumption

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, 33 años de edad, de oficio carpintero, originario de Condega municipio de Esteli, padre de 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad.  Tiene 14 años de trabajar como carpintero , elabora camas, jugueteras, puertas, gabinetes, cunas esta actividad la realiza junto con sus hermanos que se dividen la tarea mientras unos hacen los muebles los otros se dedican a venderlos. Es muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene mucha demanda los muebles que hacer, pero la falta de materia prima impide que logre cubrir la demanda de trabajo que llegan a su taller, debido a ese motivo está solicitando crédito para comprar materia prima y  una lijadora eléctrica. Esto le ayudara a cumplir con los pedidos a tiempo y lograra obtener buenos ingresos. Además que su expectativa es ampliar más la variedad de muebles que fabrica y luchas por una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is 33 years old and a carpenter by trade.  He’s originally from Condega, within the town of Esteli.  He’s the father of 2 children, ages 7 and 2.  He’s been working as a carpenter for 14 years and makes beds, toy boxes, doors, cabinets, and cribs.  He does this with his brothers who divide the tasks.  While some focus on making the furniture, the others focus on selling it.  He’s very dedicated to his work and he has lots of demand for his furniture, but his lack of supplies prevents him from meeting the needs of his customers who visit his shop.  For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy supplies and an electric blender.  This will help him fill his orders on time and provide him a good income.  He also wants to be able to expand the variety of furniture he makes and work to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anwar Group

texts.en: This group is called Anwar and is composed of three women and two men. Sawod, age 52, is the president of the group. She is married and lives in Taiz, Yemen. She would like to remodel her house. On this occasion, she needs a loan of 50,000 Yemen rials (YER) from AMB to buy building materials such as cement and lumber. She is grateful for the loan and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and lumber to remodel her house.

loans.name: Halima Group

texts.en:
This group is called Halima and consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 190,000 Yemen rials (YER) from AMB.

Halima is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She has a house where she lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a single woman, and she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy a blanket for her bedroom. She hopes to buy housing utilities and electronics for her house.

loans.use: to buy a blanket for her bedroom.

loans.name: Al-Ekhlass Group

texts.en:
This is Al-Ekhlass group. The group is made up of four members who live in Taiz, Yemen.

Ebtsam is a 36-year-old cosmetics seller. She lives in Taiz, Yemen, and characterizes herself as being a very hardworking woman. She applied for a loan of 50,000 Yemen rials (YER) from AMB to buy cosmetic materials. This loan will be useful to get more profit and enable her to help with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.en:
Dayana is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married, with five children, ages 14 to 22. 

Eleven years ago, she started her business making jars for a profit. She is asking for a loan to buy the cement and steel that are necessary during the manufacturing of jars. 

She works hard in her craft and knows that the loan will help her in her business. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy cement and steel to make jars.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 37 years old and from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She is married with five children ages 5-14. Ma. Lorena and her husband work together to raise their family well. 

She is engaged in fishing and catching crabs. She is asking for a loan to buy fishnet and crab traps, and cement for their house. She plans to make improvements in their fishing to increase the profit and provide better for their children.

loans.use: to buy fishnet, crab traps and cement.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa lives in Bien Unido, Bohol, the Philippines, together with her husband and three young children. She has been in the business of fishing for five years now. 

Nelfa gives it her best to earn a living to provide support for the needs of the family. Her business provides the income that she needs to buy nylon, plywood, and fishing nets.

Nelfa wants to expand her business to generate more income, but she needs funds to make it. She is requesting a loan to buy more nylon, plywood, and fishing nets. With the loan, Nelfa will be able to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy nylon, plywood, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a resident of Kitale in western Kenya, where she lives with her husband and one child aged 16 years. She has been in farming for seven years and runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. She currently produces tomatoes, kale and poultry for the local market.

Hellen has requested a loan of 41,600 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes the cow will improve her farming income and help her grow the business to adequately meet the family needs. She plans to acquire better grades of dairy cows in the future.

She says the high cost of production, rampant diseases and fluctuation in farming products within the local market remain the leading challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dongie

texts.en:
Dongie is engaged in fishing in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol.  He is 32 years old and married, with three school-aged children.  It is his  dream that he can continue his business and even improve it for a bigger income.  

He is asking for a loan to buy gasoline, fish nets, and fish hooks. His income will provide a nutritious diet for his family and school fees for his children, and this will also pay the family’s electric bill. 

Any additional income will be reinvested in the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, a fish net, and fish hooks

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of central Kenya. She has been in farming for over 20 years.  Currently she produces mainly maize and beans both for her family's consumption and to sell to earn more income to meet other needs.

Josphine has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming.  She says this will boost her income and help in educating her four children, who are between 12 and 5 years old and all in school.

She notes, however, that poor rains and diseases pose the greatest challenge, especially with farm crops.  She adds that she chose Juhudi Kilimo since it offers the best services, compared to other organizations providing capital to small holder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and enter poutry farming.

loans.name: Nicelin

texts.en:
Nicelin is 31 years old from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in fishing for a long time now. The business is the source of her daily income for her family's needs. 

Nicelin needs to make further investments in fishing boats and tools to be more productive at sea. She is asking for a loan to buy screens and pay for labor of people doing repairs on her fishing boat. With the loan, Nicelin will be able to improve her boat's function and durability. 

Nicelin hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable for her three children, ages 1, 9, and 10 years.

loans.use: to buy screens and pay for labor to repair her boat.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 39 years old and married, with a 10-year-old son. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

Tessie relies on her fishing business for an income, for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy floaters, weight leads, and a fishing net. Her income will help her family's needs for healthy meals and school fees for her son. 

Tessie plans to make her business bigger and expand her fishing for a better income, so she can support her child's future studies.

loans.use: to buy floaters, weight leads, and a fishing net.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
Evaluated the last period, the Mekar Sandat group decided to continue their loan from MUK. They still need the loan to increase their business, and they will stop after they all have enough savings to have the capital to run the business by themselves.

Ni Made used her loan to purchase three superior piglets. To reduce the cost, she gave them a mixed feed made from various kinds of leafs, such as banana leaf. She hopes in the next five months the pigs can grow healthy and earn a satisfactory price. All the profit will be saved for the capital of her business.

loans.use: To purchase three superior piglets.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a resident of the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single mother of two school-going children. She owns a secondhand clothes shop – a business that she has been operating for five years. Her main challenges are that some customers do not pay on time and the high purchase price of the clothes.

Teresia learnt about Milango through an employee and joined the company with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Teresia is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase bales of secondhand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to start a transport business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy herbs for her husband's herbal medicine business.

loans.name: Wasnabniha Group

texts.en: This group, called Wasnabniha, is composed of five women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. Sabah is a 47-year-old married woman who has three children. She is a brave person who will do anything for her family. She has had different types of businesses for 18 years. In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 Yemeni rials to buy canned goods and spices for her business. She hopes to have a spice store to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and spices for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is from Mutia, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 42 years old and married, with four children. 

Eden owns and operates a business selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, to the school and in the local community. Eden has engaged in this business for 20 years.

Hannah is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 that will be used to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business. This will be the second loan taken out by Eden from PMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Skyline

texts.en: Skyline, age 34, began her business because she needed a way to generate income when she found herself hardly able to provide the needs of her children. She wants to keep growing her business, but with an increase in demand, she doesn't have enough capital to keep up. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase vegetables, meat and soft drinks. Her goal is to have a large well-known restaurant and for her stall to make more money and provide employment through hiring waitresses in her restaurant. She hopes to achieve her objective soon.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat and soft drinks

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 22-year-old single man. He is a rickshaw driver with a low salary which is the only source of income for him. It is not enough to cover his costs of living.

Mostafa wants to improve his income and his standard of living by purchasing his own rickshaw. He is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new rickshaw to use for transporting goods from one area to another on customers' requests. This will increase Mostafa's capacity to work extra hours and enable him to take on additional internal requests, which will improve his income and ensure him a better future. 

Mostafa is photographed next to the rickshaw he will buy.

<u>About Shariah-compliant lending:</u>
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to complete the price of purchasing a new rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Delgerdalai

texts.en:
Delgerdalai is 46 years old and lives with her husband and her parents in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her children live separately. She is a teacher. She has been teaching at the high school for 23 years in a local town. Her husband Enhbayar works at a local company as a treasurer. 

She has wanted to improve her living circumstances for past two years. She built her house five years ago. Now she is requesting a loan of  MNT 5,000,000 to buy building materials, vacuum windows, and low pressure heating equipment. She will change the windows and heating system.  She is a calm and humble person.

loans.use: To buy building materials,  vacuum windows, and low pressure heating equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is the married father of one child. He owns a retail shop – a business which he has been operating for two years. In this shop, Omar sells assorted retail products, e.g., shoes, utensils, etc. The challenge he is facing is lack of enough stock.

Omar learnt about Milango through a friend. He has an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Omar is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy additional stock of shoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the standard of living of his family. His plan for the future is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en: Lalita is 39 years old, married and has two children, ages 8 and 7. In 2002, she established her tailoring business and works six days a week and 10 hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Lalita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With Kiva loans, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a furniture polisher and brushes for furniture polishing business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 66, is married with four children and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Victoria owns a general store to earn a living and had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 2000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Victoria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and all the members of Satya Laksana group have applied for their sixth loan. They need the loan until they ready to run the business by themselves.
Ni Ketut is a 64 years old, but still keeps her spirit to run the business. She has two children and they work and live away from her. Ni Ketut had two sows, but one of them was sold because it couldn't get pregnant. She and the members of the group are very appreciative for the loans. They will use the latest loan to purchase superior piglets and feed. Ni Ketut spent 15.000 IDR for daily needs and 200.000 IDR for electricity.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single lady who has a family of three.  She applied for a loan of five hundred thousand shillings to top up and pay school fees for her daughter, who has been admitted to a university.  

Miriam engages in several small businesses, including poultry and agriculture.  She also runs a kiosk in the market where she earns her daily income.  She deals with food and soft drinks.  Miriam's problems include limited capital to run her business and lack of skilled knowledge to run her poultry farm's daily farming practices.  When her birds are sick, it becomes expensive to hire services for skilled personnel.  Mariam has been described as a humble, hard-working, reliable person.  Her dream is to make sure that in the future she can expand and improve her farm as she educates her siblings.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is a shrewd 58-year-old single mother who has two dependents who she pays school fees for. She offers services in the form of rentals to earn a living and to pay school fees. Her main clients are low-income earners who cannot afford rent for upscale Kampala. Having been built way back in 1985, the rental properties are no longer up to the current standard and she would like to renovate them so that they can be more habitable for her tenants. Her dream is to turn them into a daycare for children of working mothers who have no maids if she gets enough funds. Her main challenge is competition.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint and to hire labourers to renovate her houses.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 56 years old and lives in Sangay Daku, Ozamis City. To earn a living, Alejandra has a general store. She earns about 1,000 each month doing this type of business. Alejandra has a requested a loan for additional capital of her business.

Alejandra has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her general store.

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.
 
Rosa runs a general store. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, beverages and other consumable products.

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is married with one child. She is 30 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rocelyn owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, such as dry goods, beverages and other consumable products.

Rocelyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy-Sta. Cruz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new molding machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 31 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. She is married and has four children. 

Maribel has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her general store

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 57 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Juliet is engaged in a native coconut wine (“tuba”) production and vending business. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to be used to redeem their pawned parcel of cocoland. 

Juliet has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. She is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to redeem their pawned parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 58 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. Celerina is engaged in a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to be used in purchasing feed for her hog-fattening business. 

Celerina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo is married with four children. He is 51 years old and lives in Kayok, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Primitivo has a motorcycle transportation business. He has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns approximately 5000 PHP. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. Primitivo has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie's goal is expand her retail store into a bigger one and to have a complete set of basic necessities. She has run her retail store for ten years.

Norie is married with four children. She would like to keep her retail store stocked up so that she can economize her fare expenses in going to and from the market where she acquires her merchandise. With regards to her business plan, she requests a loan of PHP10,000. This amount would really help to keep her business growing and to be able to let her youngest child finish her studies because education is the only inheritance she could give to her child.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 55 years old from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with 6 children. Her eldest is 35 and the youngest is 17. She has been dependent on her fishing business for an income for 20 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline for their boat, fish hooks and screen where she can dry some fish. The loan will help so she can further support and sustain their business. Erlinda plans to make her business bigger and expand her fishing for a better income, so she can support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, nylon and screen where she can dry some fish

loans.name: Susan Group

texts.en:
Susan is 43 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is married with 3 children. 

Susan has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc.  

Susan has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members. 

Susan is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga is 59 years of age and lives in Bangkal, Ozamiz City. She is married with 5 adult-aged children.

Domingga operates a small grocery store in their place. She's been doing this for almost 1 year and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan of 15000 PHP to purchase grocery items for her store.

Domingga has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. She hopes to become successful in this chosen activity.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Natividad's Group

texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Natividad is engaged in the hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for her hog fattening business. 

Natividad has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. She is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hog fattening business

loans.name: Elpedia's Group

texts.en: Elpedia is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business. Elpedia is married and has six children. She is 53 years old and lives in Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has had a manicure and pedicure business for the past 10 years. Elpedia has requested a loan to purchase meat, flour and other ingredients for longanisa processing. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, flour, and other ingredients for longanisa processing

loans.name: Arlene's Group

texts.en:
Arlene is married with 2 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City.

Arlene has a store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  to purchase additional stock for her store like beverages, spices, sacks of rice, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her living situation and to support her family especially in their daily basic needs and to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for their store like beverages, spices, sacks of rice, etc.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan has worked hard with the goal of getting her 3 children ahead. Now that she has expanded her family, she is always looking for ways to generate income for her home so that she can cover all the expenses. She has worked in buying and selling fruits and vegetables as well as fish paste (bagoong). Now, she is requesting additional working capital in the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. Thanks to this business she has been able to provide for her family and wishes to gain more income for her to lift up her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
Mema is married with 2 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Gotokan Dako, Ozamiz City.

Mema sells lotions, perfume, lipstick, lip shiner, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she  earns PHP seven thousand  doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase more beauty supplies like facial powder, lipstick, eyebrow pencils, eye shadow, lip shiner, etc.

Mema  has been a member of PMPC for a half year.  In the future, Mema hope to improve their living.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty supplies like facial powder, lipstick, eyebrow pencils, eye shadow, lip shiner, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 49 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with one child. To earn a living, Flora has a business selling a variety of bananas. She earns about 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Flora has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more bananas to sell.

Flora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
The Teratai Indah group received their third loan, with a total loan of 20,5 M IDR and a membership of 13 peoples. They have one new member. 

Sayu Komang has four children, two of them already work and live at the city. The last two are still in school. Sayu Komang will use her loan to purchase feed for the piglets. She will use the profit to support her children's education. She hopes the cooperation between her group and MUK will run smoothly for the success of their business in pig breeding.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the piglets.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 38-year-old man who is married and lives in Oroquieta City. He has five children. He makes a living by buying empty bottles or used materials suitable for recycling and sends them to companies for a good price. He has been doing this  for five years and gets a monthly income of 4,500. Rolando has requested a loan of 5,000 at GDMPC to buy more empty bottles or used materials suitable for recycling. 

He been a member of GDMPC since 2011. He hopes to sustain his business for long, long years, find good buyers and earn more income from it.

loans.use: to buy more empty bottles or used materials suitable for recycling.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 65 years old and lives in Carmen Anex, Ozamiz City. She is married with 5 adult-aged children.

Myrna is engaged in peanut and bread vending. She's been doing this for almost 35 years and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. She hopes to be successful in doing this kind of activity.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Fidelite De Dieu De Carfour 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Jeannia est le coordinatrice de son groupe FIDELITE DE DIEU de Carfour du Cape Haitien, la région nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle n'est pas marié elle n'a pas d'enfants.

Jeannia a dirigé son commerce produit de beaute pendant les 4 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce Jeannia, etait un etudiante. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt dans ventes produits cosmetique.
Jeannia espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de fidelite ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmetiques. Elle dit que son défi principal c'est d'avoir plus d'argent pour obtenir un plus grand commerce.
texts.en:
Jeannia is the coordinator for her Fidelité de Dieu de Carfour group in Haitian Cape, the northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water very retricted. She is not married and does not have any children.

Jeannia has managed her beauty products company for the past four years. Before setting up this business she was a student. She would like to use this loan for the sale of cosmetics and hopes that it will help to expand her business. The other members of the Fidelité group need a loan for businesses such as grocery sales and cosmetic sales. She says that her principal challenge is to have more money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lavenie De Ferrier 2 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Belius est le coordinateur de son groupe Lavenie de Ferrier 2 & 4. Il n`est pas marié et il a 4 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Belius a dirigé son commerce pendant les 16 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il vendu des produits alimentaires et boissons gaseuse. Belius voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à l`achat des charbon. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce, c'est aussi l'objectif principal.
texts.en:
Belius is the coordinator of his Laverie de Ferrie 2 & 4 group. He is not married and he has four children. He lives in the northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water very restricted.

Belius has managed his business for the past 16 years. Before setting it up, he sold groceries and fizzy drinks. He would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of charcoal and hopes it will help him to expand his business. This is his main objective.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Sumber Rahayu group is a group of village women who work together as pig farmers. They are joined in a group to get funding and training from MUK.
Ni Luh is married and her husband work as a farmer. Ni Luh using a loan to buy four pigs that will be maintained for 5 months for fattening. The remainder of the loan used to buy pig feed.
Ni Luh spent 5,000 IDR for kitchen and 100,000 IDR to pay for electricity and water. Although her business is still small, Ni Luh hope this business can support their children's education to buy books and other school purposes, and also kitchen tools.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is 55 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 5 children. 
Nilo is engaged in sand and gravel quarrying business and earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cubic sand and gravel for volume delivery. 
Nilo has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Nilo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional sand and gravel

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is from the village of District 3. She is married to Camilo, who helps her to manages their business. Josefina sells fruits and vegetables in the market of Cauayan City. She has been doing this for seven years and earns about PHP 3,500 a week. At this moment, Josefina is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy eggplant, tomatoes, bananas and avocados to sell. In the future, Josefina hopes to attract more customers and have a big business to make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, bananas and avocados to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna of Panalsalan, Plaridel helps her family through a furniture making business. She is 60 years old and married with 9 kids, and tries her best to earn on her own. For 10 years, she has managed this business and earns about 4,500 per month. For the time being, she’s in need to buy more bamboo to be used in her business. She joined last 2009 and thanks to GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 5,000 they provided to her. Myrna desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to be used in her furniture business

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz is 33 years old. She is still single and currently residing in Gonzaga where she manages a general store. Paz is thankful because she has been earning 2,000 PHP each day which is savings for the educational purposes of her siblings and for her business promotion. To make her source of income more profitable, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, biscuits, breads, milk, sugar, hotdogs and beverages. Hopefully, the loan will be a great help in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, breads, milk, sugar, hotdogs and beverages

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en: With the full support from her husband and the family, Ni Ketut continues her loan to increase the business. The loan is used to purchase superior piglets. To reduce the cost of feed, she gives the piglets a mix feed made from banana leaves and small fish. Her husband helps her with finding small fish at the sea. The smell of fish makes the piglets love to eat and makes them grow faster. She has a dream to renovate her house with the profit.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 41 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran. She is married and a mother of two children. Josie is a farmer. She plants, harvests and sells rice for a living. She has been in this work for 7 years and earns 20,000 per month. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. Josie has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Josie hopes to gain more income from this production and purchase more space for her plantation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 58 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City. She is married with only one child. 

Araceli has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years. Araceli requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional products such as sacks of rice, salt, sugar, spices, canned goods, detergents, etc.. Araceli has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Araceli hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, salt, sugar, spices, canned goods, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Jongie

texts.en:
Jongie, 43 years old, is married and has four children. Jongie sells fruits and vegetables in the market to increase his income. Jongie is willing to work hard to uplift his family from poverty. He wants to expand his business and he would like to make his business more profitable. 

For this reason, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and onions to resell for a profit. This will help improve his income. In the future, Jongie would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and give the best education to his children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and onions to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Michael Angelo

texts.en:
Michael Angelo is from Dicayas, Dipolog City. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. Michael Angelo is just starting this business, an eatery. 

This is his first time taking a loan, and he is availing himself of 50,000 PHP taken out from PMPC which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients for his eatery business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for his eatery business.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 49 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City. Isabelita is married with two children. 

Isabelita has a store that sells variety of products. Isabelita has had this business for 15 years. Isabelita requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, soaps, junk foods, spices, sacks of rice, beverages and etc.

Isabelita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Isabelita hopes to save to have funds in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, soaps, junk foods, spices, sacks of rice and beverages.

loans.name: Arlene May

texts.en:
Arlene May of Biasong, Lopez Jaena supports her family through her pot-making business. She’s a 29-year-old married woman with two children, who tries her best to earn on her own. For two years, she has managed this business and earns about PHP 5,500 per month. For the time being, she needs to buy more clay to use in her business. 

She joined this year and thanks GDMPC micro-finance for the loan of PHP 7,000 they provided to her. Arlene May desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clay to be used in her business.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is 30 years old and is married to Florante. Since they have been blessed with three-school-aged children, she has doubled her industriousness in her general store to gain enough funds for her family. She opens early in the morning to promote her store. This work is not easy but is satisfying especially if she gains a high income. To make this possible, she is requesting a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase shampoo, soap, breads, canned goods, sterilized milk and beverages.

Elita is motivated by her desire to offer her family a better quality of life. Hopefully, she will earn a high income this time which she can invest for the education of her children and to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soap, breads, canned goods, sterilized milk and beverages.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 49 years old and a widow. She is from Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She has three children who help her in taking care of their bananas. They have been involved in raising bananas for three years and earn PHP 6,000 a month. 

In 2006, Marilyn joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old, and is married to Epifanio, a father who is busy managing their farm land. Despite their poverty, Elsa still has the determination to succeed. Elsa is engaged in a poultry business. She usually acquires chickens to raise. 

At this time, Elsa is asking for a loan of an amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more chickens to raise and to make a profit. Elsa would like to make the business profitable to sustainably secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She has been doing this for one year and earns a net income of about PHP 500 a day. Estrelita is doing her best to meet their family house hold needs. She wants to grow and expand her business. 

To make it possible, Estrelita is asking for a loan of an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy eggplants, string beans, squash and bananas to sell. She believes that availing herself of the loan will have a positive impact on her business.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, string beans, squash and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
Crisencio, aged 34, is a farmer who grows rice and harvests it for sale to make an income. He has been doing this for four years now. He is married to Divina who takes care of their child and also does household chores. 

Crisencio is now borrowing a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides) to use in rice farming. He hopes this will be granted to him as an additional capital so he can produce crops abundantly. Crisencio hopes that he will someday have better sales of rice so that he can give a more prosperous life to his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to use in rice farming.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is a farmer from General Balao. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. One is still attending school and needs a daily allowance. He has been planting and harvesting rice for over 10 years now and he makes just enough income for their sustenance. 

He still aims for a more productive harvest which is why he is borrowing a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in the farming business. This will help ensure a good growth of his crops. He promises to pay back his loan in full and is hoping that someday he will continue to grow good rice crops and increase his income so that he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, and insecticides used in the farming business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 23 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is single.

To earn a living, Jenelyn has a business selling a variety of foods. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Jenelyn has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more raw foods to cook and sell. 

Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jenelyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw foods to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ma. Juditha

texts.en:
Ma. Juditha, 52 years of age, is married and has three children. She is a resident of San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She started her business with a little capital. Now, with the help through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages. 

She hopes that her business will prosper so that it can help to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 54 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. Evangeline is single without children.
 
Evangeline has a store that sells a variety of products. Evangeline has had this business for four years.

Evangeline requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
  
Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Evangeline hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She has been doing this for almost three years and earns about a net income of 500 PHP a day. 

Geraldine is doing her best to meet her family's needs. She wants to grow and expand her business. 

To make it possible, Geraldine is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy eggplant, string beans, squash and bananas to sell. She believes that availing herself of the loan will have a positive impact on her business.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, string beans, squash and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is listing Rita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Annabel's Group

texts.en:
Annabel is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

Annabel is married and has two school-aged children and two adult children. Annabel is 42 years old. 

For almost five months, Annabel has been a dried fish vendor. Annabel earns approximately 5,000 PHP every month. 

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her business. Annabel has been a member of PMPC for one year. Annabel hopes to earn more than 15,000 PHP in the future and to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: To purchased dried fish for vending.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is a 54-year old resident of Poblacion, Sinacaban. He provides for his two children's needs from the little amount of 6,000 PHP he gains monthly from his own piggery business, which he has had for five years. 

Since 2010 he has been a member of GDMPC, and he has applied for a loan at GDMPC microfinance of 10,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Claudio wants to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married and has five children. Nenita is 38 years old, and she resides at Matugas Alto, Jimenez. 

Nenita owns and operates a gardening business to earn a living, and she's been three years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this business. 

Recently, Nenita joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  

In the future, Nenita wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 48 years old and lives in Buenavista, Tudela. Jessie is married and has six children. 

Jessie has a store that sells a variety of products, and she has had this business for seven years. 

Jessie requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Jessie hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City. She is married and has five school-age children.

To earn a living, Marilyn has a business selling a variety of products such as tea, coffee, soap, cosmetics, etc. She earns about 10,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

Marilyn has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase products such as coffee, tea, herbal products, soaps, cosmetics, etc.

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business and support her children for their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products such as coffee, tea, herbal products, soaps cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 49-year-old married mother of five, lives in Maikay,Tudela where she has been operating a store that sells a variety of products for eight years now. A member of PMPC for nine months, Josephine has requested a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

In the future, she hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Gina's Group

texts.en:
Gina, a 41-year-old married mother of one, lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Mis. Occ. where she has a general store and earns approximately PHP 1,800 each month. She is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport.

Gina, a member of PMPC for almost one year, is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business. In the future, Gina hopes to be successful in her chosen enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Jeriel

texts.en:
Jeriel lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been making her living by providing transportation services for three years, to support her child. For this 27-year old mother, nothing would make her more happy than seeing her child successful in their studies. 

Jeriel gets an income of 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from her business. She joined GDMPC this year and has borrowed 7,000 Philippine pesos to repair the vehicle used in her business. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 39 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. She is married with 4 children. 

Marianita has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 5 years. Marianita requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.. Marianita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Marianita hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is single. She is 63 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Evangeline is a farmer and owns a rice field to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested 7,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her rice fields.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a widow with 2 children. Ana Maria is 56 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City.

Ana Maria sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes. Ana Maria has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Ana Maria hopes to improve her living situation and to support her family, especially in their daily basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is married with 1 child. Alfredo is 22 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Alfredo sells spices and generic medicines to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, he earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more medicines and spices to sell/retail. Alfredo is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Alfredo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines and spices to sell/retail

loans.name: Badru

texts.en:
Badru is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Badru has been working hard to manage his shop, where he sells coffee seeds, husks and maize. 

To help expand his business, Badru has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more coffee and maize, and will help Badru to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living by meeting his basic needs. Badru hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a processor machine for coffee. 

Badru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Badru, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and maize

loans.name: Purreh

texts.en:
Purreh is 57 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children. 

Purreh is engaged in an eatery business and earns approximately 5,000.00 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan to be used in redeeming her mortgaged parcel of cocoland (agricultural property where coconuts grow). Purreh has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Purreh hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming her mortgaged parcel of cocoland (agricultural property where coconuts grow).

loans.name: Gwendolyn's Group

texts.en:
Gwendolyn is 48 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents.
 
Gwendolyn has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

Gwendolyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gwendolyn hopes to expand her business. Gwendolyn is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 61 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. Leonora is widowed with six children. 
Leonora works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. Leonora has been doing this for seven years.Leonora has requested a loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional fishing materials. 
Leonora has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To mulch his bananas, expand his piggery, and buy corn, coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 25-year-old carpenter in Mombasa. He is married to Jacinta. He has done carpentry for the last six years, and he is doing great. 

This is his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase new hammers, nails and chisels. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and repay his loan. 

He hopes to gradually expand his business and be able to support his family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase new hammers, nails and chisels.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en: Vivencia is 60 years old and married. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She has three children who have helped her take care of her banana crop. She has been raising bananas for 10 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Vivencia joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret does farming in Olkalau town, where she plants and sells cash crops such as potatoes, maize and beans. She is 48 years old and married to Obadia, who is also a farmer. They have six children.

This will be her second loan amount, and she plans to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use in her farm during this planting season.

She hopes to improve her farming methods and make more income so as to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Kasangati region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, posho flour and gnuts. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour, baking flour and cooking oil, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and help her grow her business with the expanded inventory. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to build up rental houses. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour, baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Carmilita

texts.en:
Carmilita is 31 years old and lives in Mayors Village Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 
Carmilita is engaged in business (snack vending) and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12000 PHP to purchase materials for her house repair.
Carmilita  has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Carmilita hopes to expand her business and to finish her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 52 years old. He is married to Mary and together they have two children aged 20 and seven years. He sells goats and has been in the business for the past 22 years, making a great income.

This is his first business loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase more goats for resale in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to fatten and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Kasangati region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past four years, Annet has been working hard to manage her hardware shop, which sells cement, iron sheets and bars. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more iron sheets, wire mesh, rings and cement, and will help Annet to generate greater profits, improve her standards of living, and pay for family necessities. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to build up a permanent house on her mortgage. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets, wire mesh, rings and cement

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is married with two children. She is 33 years old and lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. Lily owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting cassava to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years and earns 6,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Lily has become a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, just this year. In the future, Lily's plan is to save her returns in order to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her depot, which sells beer and wine. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks in bulk to sell, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and grow her business with the increased sales. Rebecca hopes that, in the future, she will be able to sell quality products. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: For over five years in Labo, Ozamis City, Thelma, a 50-year-old married mother of four children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month this way. In 2007, Thelma joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, beans, posho, and other general items. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and other commodities, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and enlarge the business with proceeds from increased sales. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to sell quality products. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and other commodities

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 36-year-old businesswoman who sells second-hand clothes in Mombasa. She is a married mother of three school-going children. She has been running a second-hand clothes retail stall for the last four years and she is doing great. 

This will be Francisca’s second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more second-hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, George has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells posho, rice, sugar, and other commodities. 

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda, posho, bread, and other goods, and will help George to generate greater profits and help him grow the business with increased sales. George hopes that in the future, he will be able to sell quality products in a larger business. 

George is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more soda, posho, bread, and other goods

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 43 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with five children. 

She has had a store selling a variety of products for seven years and has been a member of PMPC for the same amount of time. 

Emerita has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents etc. In the future, she hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents etc.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is 37 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Sumaya has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells beans, sugar and rice. 

To help expand her business, Sumaya has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, posho (maize flour), bread and other goods, and will help Sumaya to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Sumaya hopes that, in the future, she will be able to be a good entrepreneur. 

Sumaya is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Sumaya who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beans, posho (maize flour), bread and other goods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 57 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Grace has been working hard to generate income through her money transfer business and by selling chickens. 

To help expand her businesses, Grace has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hens, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve her way of living. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to have a large farm. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to support her mobile money transfer business and side business of selling hens

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo is 52 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Consejo has a business selling a variety of food including barbecue. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her barbecue business.

Consejo has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Consejo would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her barbecue business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis 38 years old. He is married with three children aged 16, 14, and 12 years. He mends shoes and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This will be his second business loan. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to secure a permanent place to do his job. He hopes to start selling shoes in the near future.

loans.use: to secure a permanent place where he will do his business.

loans.name: Jamelin

texts.en:
Jamelin is married with three children. She is 35 years old and residing in Bagakay, Ozamis City. Jamelin owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living; she's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP through the business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2009, Jamelin joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Nonaliza

texts.en:
Nonaliza is from the village of Manante. She is a responsible mother who is willing to do everything that brings her income. She has been a hog-raiser for almost three years. She usually earns about 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month every time she disposes one. 

Nonaliza wants to have more pigs to raise. In this regard, Nonaliza is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise. With her determination and hard work, she will soon grow a better living through her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 56 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with eight children.
 
Leo has a store that sells consumable products. He has had this business since just this year. He requested a loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to be used in purchasing more stock for his general store, such as toothpaste, shampoo and beverages.

Leo has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Leo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for his general store, such as toothpaste, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 40 years old, married to Jackline and has been blessed with five children. He is an electrician, and he sells and repairs electrical appliances. He has been running the business for the last 16 years. His monthly income is 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is servicing his third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD., and this will assist him to purchase more electrical gadgets, spare parts and associated items. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in and increase his inventory. 

His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will make him improve the living standards of the family

loans.use: to purchase more electrical gadgets, spare parts and associated items for sale.

loans.name: Tehmina's Group

texts.en:
Tehmina is a 33-year-old, hardworking woman. She is living with her husband, two sons, and one daughter. Her two sons are studying in fourth and fifth class. She is working as a cook in a restaurant. Meanwhile, since 2000, her husband has been running his own tile and stone shop and is interested in continuing to grow his business. As both of them are working so hard to provide for the household expenses, they have not been able to give enough time to their children for the past few days. 

Tehmina is a member of a three-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva Field Partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's tile and stone shop. He will be using this amount to purchase more materials like tiles, stones, and a tile cutting machine from different cities like Peshawar and Lahore.
